publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-4229 Jack McConnell: Congratulations to His Excellency President Dr Bingu wa Mutharika and Hon Joyce Banda—That the Parliament congratulates His Excellency President Dr Bingu wa Mutharika and Hon Joyce Banda on their inauguration as President and Vice President of the Republic of Malawi following the general election held on 19 May 2009; notes that the interim report by the Commonwealth Observer group that the elections, only the fourth multi-party elections in Malawi’s history, were peaceful and well-managed; wishes all new and returning members of Parliament every success for the next Parliamentary term, and looks forward to Scotland and Malawi continuing to work together to support Malawi’s Development. Supported by : Mike Pringle*, Jackie Baillie*, Dr Richard Simpson*, David Stewart*, Karen Whitefield*, Mary Mulligan*, Patricia Ferguson*, Karen Gillon*, Murdo Fraser*, Cathie Craigie*, Bill Butler*, Mr Frank McAveety*, George Foulkes*, Brian Adam *, Aileen Cam pbell*, Jam ie McGrigor*, Patrick Harvie*, Alex Johnstone*, Rhona Brankin*, Ian McKee*, Elaine Murray*, Bob Doris*, Marlyn Glen*

S3M-4229 Congratulations to His Excellency President Dr Bingu wa Mutharika and Hon Joyce Banda (lodged on 26 May 2009) Des McNulty*, Jamie Hepburn*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Robert Brown*, Robin Harper*, Christopher Harvie*, Ross Finnie*, Cathy Jamieson*, Gil Paterson*, David Whitton*, Trish Godman*
S3M-4229 Congratulations to His Excellency President Dr Bingu wa Mutharika and Hon Joyce Banda (lodged on 26 May 2009) Hugh Henry*, Liam McArthur*

S3M-4229 Jack McConnell: Congratulations to His Excellency President Dr Bingu wa Mutharika and Hon Joyce Banda—That the Parliament congratulates His Excellency President Dr Bingu wa Mutharika and Hon Joyce Banda on their inauguration as President and Vice President of the Republic of Malawi following the general election held on 19 May 2009; notes that the interim report by the Commonwealth Observer group that the elections, only the fourth multi-party elections in Malawi’s history, were peaceful and well-managed; wishes all new and returning members of parliament every success for the next parliamentary term, and looks forward to Scotland and Malawi continuing to work together to support Malawi’s development. Supported by: Mike Pringle, Jackie Baillie, Dr Richard Simpson, David Stewart, Karen Whitefield, Mary Mulligan, Patricia Ferguson, Karen Gillon, Murdo Fraser, Cathie Craigie, Bill Butler, Mr Frank McAveety, George Foulkes, Brian Adam, Aileen Campbell, Jamie McGrigor, Patrick Harvie, Alex Johnstone, Rhona Brankin, Ian McKee, Elaine Murray, Bob Doris, Marlyn Glen, Des McNulty, Jamie Hepburn, Shirley-Anne Somerville, Robert Brown, Robin Harper, Christopher Harvie, Ross Finnie, Cathy Jamieson, Gil Paterson, David Whitton, Trish Godman, Hugh Henry, Liam McArthur, Ken Macintosh*, Dave Thompson*
S3M-4229 Congratulations to His Excellency President Dr Bingu wa Mutharika and Hon Joyce Banda (lodged on 26 May 2009) Irene Oldfather*, Sarah Boyack*, Cathy Peattie*, Stuart McMillan*
S3M-4229 Congratulations to His Excellency President Dr Bingu wa Mutharika and Hon Joyce Banda (lodged on 26 May 2009) Rhoda Grant*, Peter Peacock*
